February 2, 1960
i
Dr* Harry Skomia
NAEB Headquarters
14 Gregory Hall
Urbanat Illinois
Dear Harry:
Your letter and the other materials arrived today and I think 1 had
better answer immediately before they get lost under the mess on ray
desk. 1 am trying to get a paper finished which I am supposed to
read at the American Association of School Administrators on instruc¬
tional television research, getting a new research course ready for
next semester, and reading term papers and exams* If I don't answer
this and get it right off, some student is liable to get it handed
back to him with a final grade*
To answer your questions - or react to the problems - one at a time:
1* I think the idea of a regular life-cycle for committees is
a good one. New members and new chairmen are needed con¬
stantly to provide Infusions of fresh ideas* It seems to
me also that committee membership serves an educational
function for the members* I helps them to learn more about
and, consequently, to become more interested in the organ¬
ization* This, it seems to me, is essential for the con¬
tinuing existence of the NAEB* This is another important
reason for a rotating membership. Anyway, I vote for it*
2* In line with the consensus of the 1959 committee, 1 would
alter the statement of the research committee's responsi¬
bilities to read as follows:
RESEARCH COMMITTEE — This committee advises the Pres¬
ident and Board on all matters pertaining to research
in the educational broadcasting field; provides lead¬
ership in defining research needs and in suggesting
research programs for meeting these needs, seeks to
stimulate and encourage significant research activities
wherever they may be located, coordinates the research
